I am not sure if this is a new problem or a dup of this one. If a dup, feel free to close it again.
This looks like a different problem (i.e. it looks like third party code is returning a null when it shouldn't). Do you have any steps to try and reproduce the problem?
I have entered bug 199262 for the issue mentioned in comment 4. I'm moving this bug back to the FIXED state.
*** Bug 200984 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
